availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William George Linn (Grant County, Kentucky, resident)

body.p: Grant County, Kentucky, resident. Kentucky native. Son of Andrew Linn and Adelia Linn. Attended school in Grant County, Kentucky, in 1850. Household owned four enslaved persons in Grant County in 1850. Attended school in Grant County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Grant County, Williamstown, p. 360B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Grant County.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Grant County, Williamstown, p. 987.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Missouri, Livingston County, Chillicothe, p. 459B.
"W. G. Linn Dead," The Chillicothe Constitution (Chillicothe, MO), September 1, 1906, p. 1.
"William George Linn (1844-1906)," Find A Grave, Memorial 157262274, accessed June 5, 2020, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/157262274.
